title: SAP Programmer Analyst
education: BA or BS degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Science, Business or the equivalent of 4 years of experience in an IT application or Infrastructure profession.
scope: Facilitates the delivery and support of the development portion of projects/programs within specified functional area(s) including Materials Management, Launch and/or Outbound Logistics.   Coordinates and takes the lead role for the technical/functional development and support of IT applications in his/her area of responsibility. Coordinates all development aspects including reports, interfaces, conversion programs, database design and creation, enhancements. May also include SAP Portal development, ABAP, SAP UI5/Fiori, JAVA web-dynpro, Cloud Architecture and Cloud Platforms (Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Openstack & OpenShift).   Provides accurate estimates based on design documents, including data mapping, and interface models.
description: Orange Bees is leader in the upstate region of South Carolina for its world class software development. Established in 2013, Orange Bees, aim to improve the manufacturing, insurance, financial, association, and retail industries; where we have an extensive track record of success in Product Engineering, Enterprise Management, System Integration, Mobile ApplicationDevelopment, Web Application Development, and Data Analytics.Our client, an innovative automotive manufacturing company, is looking for a talented individual for an opportunity in the Greenville/Spartanburg Area of South Carolina. This position is a long-term contract position with the possibility of multi-year extension and conversion to a full-time/permanent position. In this role, you will be responsible for coordinating and taking the lead role for the technical/functional development and support of SAP IT applications in his/her area of responsibility. To be considered for this role, you will have a Bachelors degree in Computer Science or other related discipline, and five or more years of experience planning, designing, developing, and implementing SAP applications. Experience within a manufacturing environment is strongly preferred.
responsibilities: Performs planning, analysis, designing, requirements definition, functional design, development, testing and implementation of IT solutions.
Provides support for difficult and complex system environments.
Provides support, assistance and training to users.
Coordinates activities simultaneously for multiple projects.
Uses ITPM Agile methodology effectively when performing all tasks.
Meets with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business requirements and systems goals, and identify and resolve business systems issues.
Ensures compatibility and interoperability of in-house computing systems.
Reviews and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.
Creates systems models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to application developers.
Coordinates and performs in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems.
Conducts research on software products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts.
experience: 5+ years of programming experience using a variety of languages and technologies including ABAP/4, SAP UI5/Fiori, SAP BI/BW, Data Warehouses, C++, JAVA, HTML, JSP, J2EE, SQL, Oracle, UNIX/LINUX, XSLT (preferred).

5+ years of experience planning, analyzing, designing, testing, implementing, documenting and training in a variety of SAP areas, preferably Warehouse Management, Yard Management and/or Inbound Logistics.
5+ years of experience working in a customer service orientated environment.
5+ years of experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
knowledge: 5+ years of functional knowledge in systems in area of responsibility such as SAP R/3 related modules or production systems.
5+ years of experience executing and communicating project plans.
5+ years of knowledge of the Systems Development Life Cycle.
5+ years of knowledge of IT infrastructure components - Operating Systems, Networks, Databases, Internet Technologies, etc.
3+ years of experience communicating ideas in both technical and user-friendly language. Basic knowledge of cost and budget control

title: Security Analyst IAM
education: BA or BS degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Science, Business, or the equivalent of 4 years professional related IT experience.
scope: Facilitates the delivery support of DevOps User Stories within specified functional area(s). Serves as an Identity and Access Management (IAM) subject matter expert and consultant. Works with Product Owners and DevOps teams and within the global Identity and Access Management and Cyber Security organization to support initiatives and functional departments in all aspects of IAM.
description:
Orange Bees is leader in the upstate region of South Carolina for its world class software development. Established in 2013, Orange Bees, aim to improve the manufacturing, insurance, financial, association, and retail industries; where we have an extensive track record of success in Product Engineering, Enterprise Management, System Integration, Mobile Application Development, Web Application Development, and Data Analytics.

Our client, an innovative automotive manufacturing company, is looking for a talented individual for an opportunity in the Greenville/Spartanburg Area of South Carolina. This position is a long-term contract position with the possibility of multi-year extension and conversion to a full-time/permanent position.
responsibilities: Supports the roll-out and operation of global IAM initiatives within the BMW Group for certain products, departments and locations.
Serves as a technical lead for small - medium sized initiatives as delegated by the Product Owner and Line Manager.
Serves as a consultant and subject matter expert on IT initiatives and products in IAM and IT Security related topics.
Researches and coordinates feasibility studies and makes recommendations on software products and services in support of improving business processes and cost savings.
Analyzes the requirements for IAM systems and processes and designs work orders for external IAM providers.
Qualifies sophisticated IAM incidents and requests and routes them to the respective global support groups.
Third level support for IAM applications.
Assists Product Owners and Line Managers, with the accountability for the system development, integrity, security and scalability in area of responsibility.
Completes technical documentation and test scripts.
Conducts unit and integration testing and supports the set-up of automated testing and continuous deployment environments.
Adheres to defined development standards and procedures in documenting, testing, reviews, and feasibility studies
Performs other duties as assigned by operations supervisor.
experience: 3+ years of experience working with Identity and Access Management technologies.
2+ years of experience driving products from concept and ideation through successful launch.
2+ years working on a team employing standardized project delivery methods (Agile/Scrum development methods preferred)
1+ year experience in project management including an understanding of non-functional requirements.
knowledge: 3+ years of knowledge of authentication and credential management technologies and protocols (e.g. LDAP, oAuth, SAML, Kerberos, PGP, and SSL/TLS).

3+ years of knowledge of Authorization, Authentication and Credential management systems (e.g. Strong Authentication products and solutions, PKI solutions, Single Sign On solutions, Role Modeling and Provisioning).
3+ years of knowledge of scripting languages (e.g. Bash, Perl, and Python)
Basic object-oriented architecture and design skills.
Basic understanding of ITIL and IT-Service-Management.

title: Network Analyst WAN
education: BA/BS Degree in Information Technology or the equivalent of 4 years of professional IT experience. MS degree (preferred).
scope: Provide a structured, managed, dependable, secure and cost effective network infrastructure and services for multiple locations in the Americas region.
description:
Orange Bees is leader in the upstate region of South Carolina for its world class software development. Established in 2013, Orange Bees, aim to improve the manufacturing, insurance, financial, association, and retail industries; where we have an extensive track record of success in Product Engineering, Enterprise Management, System Integration, Mobile Application Development, Web Application Development, and Data Analytics.

Our client, an innovative automotive manufacturing company, is looking for a talented individual for an opportunity in the Greenville/Spartanburg Area of South Carolina. This position is a short-term contract position with the possibility of multi-year extension and conversion to a full-time/permanent position. The ideal candidate will have project management experience in an enterprise environment, working specifically with WAN and managing service providers. Candidates won't need to travel but will need to have a flexible work schedule to accommodate the America's as well as Brazil, Canada and Mexico. This person will be the lead, working with a variety of business units to complete a migration of all new switches and circuits.
responsibilities: Serves as a network subject matter expert, especially within the area of WAN connectivity, including WAN routing protocols, MPLS, GLBP/HSRP, remote troubleshooting, acceleration and packet optimization, and SDN appliances.
Coordinates with multiple remote teams to include providers.
Supports and steers future ready strategies like Agile, cloud, scripting and automation, software defined networking, and other applicable technologies.
Recommends and facilitates quality improvement efforts, keeping up to date with current and emerging technology.
Collaborates and participates with the global WAN community of practice for new strategies and products.

Designs, leads, executes, and/or participates in small short-term to enterprise-wide multi-year network infrastructure projects within network operations, including coordinating with multi-organization or multi-cultural groups.  Ensures projects are completed on-time and within budget.

Provides support for network operations including coordination of small and large scale changes with the appropriate operations groups and business groups.  Supports operations via on call, escalation and tier three level support, incident response, and/or problem management.
Performs other duties as assigned by Operations Supervisor.
experience: 3+ years of experience in Information Technology with a focus on networks to include 1+ years of technical experience in the network WAN field.
knowledge: 3+ years of experience with ITSM, CMDB and network tools.
3+ years of experience working with scripting, automation and software-defined networking.
1+ years of experience working within an Agile environment.
1+ years of experience working with and steering external service providers.

title: Mobility Software Engineer II
education: BA/BS Degree in Business, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering preferred or the equivalent of 4 years professional IT related experience. MS degree (preferred).
scope: Develops leading edge technologies and know-how from Industry, partner companies, local universities and internal partners into automotive concepts, then into project development and Integration processes. Identifies emerging technologies in order to build software and/or hardware prototypes and production ready solutions.  Areas of focus include but not limited to Vehicle IT, Mobility, Social Networks, web and other enabling technologies. Serves as a technical expert and consultant to other engineers and developers. Has the ability to manage medium-scale enterprise-wide projects according to standard ITPM methodology.
description: Orange Bees is leader in the upstate region of South Carolina for its world class software development. Established in 2013, Orange Bees, aim to improve the manufacturing, insurance, financial, association, and retail industries; where we have an extensive track record of success in Product Engineering, Enterprise Management, System Integration, Mobile Application Development, Web Application Development, and Data Analytics.\n\nOur client, an innovative automotive manufacturing company, is looking for a talented individual for an opportunity in the Greenville/Spartanburg Area of South Carolina. This position is a long-term contract position with the possibility of multi-year extension and conversion to a full-time/permanent position.
responsibilities: Manages the visualization and realization of future technologies which will support the complete process from development of concepts and vision to full production ready solutions which can be integrated rapidly into the automotive environment.
Investigates and evaluates emerging technologies to envision how they can be used to develop new strategic directions and competitive advantage for the team as needed.
Demonstrates extremely high technical capabilities in software and hardware development for emerging technologies.
Develops strategic and tactical awareness and planning of technology and resources necessary for successful completion of small and medium-scale projects.
Serves as a primary point of contact for other engineers and specialists in the team to provide expert knowledge and troubleshooting skills.
Serves as internal consultant to other developers and engineers as needed, providing assistance in all phases of product life-cycle development.

Mentors developers and engineers on latest technologies and techniques.  Assists the team in process matters as related to systems development/support. Provides the necessary on the job training and development of associates/contractors within the team.
Plans, analyzes, designs (including functional design), and defines requirements, tests and implements solutions according to ITPM standards.
Simultaneously manages multiple small to medium sized project teams, (including budgets) according to standard ITPM, ECC or other project management methodologies.
Clearly and proactively communicates project plans, milestones and current status to Project Sponsor, Manager and Project Manager.
Maintains accurate, meaningful and updated technical and non-technical documentation pertaining to all aspects of area(s) of responsibility.
Analyzes business critical processes, evaluates and recommends improvements.
Measures performance of delivered services through set of agreed metrics. Manages appropriate action to make corrections so that all services agreements are met.
Performs cost analysis for systems and determines most cost-effective way to solve business issues as related to systems development.
Manages medium-scale enterprise-wide projects.
Performs other duties as assigned by operations supervisor.
experience: 3+ years of technical experience in Information Technology to include 2+ years of experience in mobile technologies, web, vehicle IT with demonstrated strengths in software and hardware design, development, Integration and testing.
knowledge: 5+ years knowledge of latest development technologies and design methods for platforms e.g. Apple iPhone, Windows Mobile, Android, Social Networking, Web, etc.
5+ years knowledge of how to integrate and test various hardware components and systems.
3-5 years knowledge of emerging technology concepts and products.
3-5 years knowledge of project management and proven leadership skills.
3-5 years of written/oral communication and presentation skills.
3-5 years of ability to Interface with the business to meet requirements and targets.
